definition: Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
don't forget past events, they can guide you in future (idiom); benefit from past experience
pinyin: qian2 shi4 bu4 wang4 , hou4 shi4 zhi1 shi1

definition: victim of an accident/casualty/martyr for one's country
much hardships may awaken a nation (idiom); calamity that prompts renewal
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to observe a moment of silence in tribute
to die in an accident/to die for a just cause
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
deep suffering can lead to enlightenment (idiom)/storms make oaks take deeper root
